page.title: 16PEATS FOR FUEL IN SANDWICK
page.content: Here I am lying in the peat basket about to be burned. I can remember when I was back at home in the peat bank. "Oh, that was the life!" We heard a rumble of wheels and knew that the people had come to dig us up. The spade like instrument used is called a 'tushkar'.After we have been "cassen" or cut we have to be raised, turned and put in bags. Raising is when we get set on edge in small piles to dry. When we get turned we go through the whole process again. A week or two later the people come back again and put us into bags. The bags are stacked into the trailer and the tractor takes us to the house. There we are built into a stack from where we are taken into the house in a basket ready to be burned.
